name: SearchWebsiteContent
description:
Search for website content on a HubSpot account.

Use this tool to retrieve website content that matches specified search criteria within a HubSpot account. Filters can include content type, domain, or URL path.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The term to search for in the HubSpot website content.

value_schema.description: The term to search for.

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: The number of search results to return. Defaults to 10 and has a maximum of 100.

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of results to be returned in a single response. Defaults to `10`. Maximum value is `100`.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Integer used to page through results. Use the offset from the previous request to access the next set of results.

value_schema.description: Used to page through the results. If there are more results than specified by the `limit` parameter, you will need to use the value of offset returned in the previous request to get the next set of results.

parameters.name: content_language_code
parameters.description: Specifies the language of content to be searched using a valid ISO 639-1 code (e.g. 'es' for Spanish).

value_schema.description: Specifies the language of content to be searched. This value must be a valid [ISO 639-1 language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `es` for Spanish)

parameters.name: popularity_boost
parameters.description: Specify the boost factor for a result based on its view count. Defaults to 1.0.

value_schema.description: Specifies how strongly a result is boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 1.0.

parameters.name: maximum_boost_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum amount a result will be boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 5.0.

value_schema.description: Specifies the maximum amount a result will be boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 5.0. Read more about elasticsearch boosting [here](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-boost.html).

parameters.name: boost_recent_time_window
parameters.description: A relative time window to boost scores of documents published within this period. Use '10d' for 10 days. Supported units: ms, s, m, h, d. Applicable to blog posts only.

value_schema.description: Specifies a relative time window where scores of documents published outside this time window decay. This can only be used for blog posts. For example, boostRecent=10d will boost documents published within the last 10 days. Supported timeunits are ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

parameters.name: hubdb_table_id
parameters.description: Specifies a specific HubDB table to search. Only results from this table are returned. Can be combined with 'hubdb_query' for further filtering.

value_schema.description: Specifies a specific HubDB table to search. Only returns results from the specified table. Can be used in tandem with the `hubdbQuery` parameter to further filter results.

parameters.name: hubdb_query_filter
parameters.description: Specify a HubDB query to filter search results in the specified table.

value_schema.description: Specify a HubDB query to further filter the search results.

parameters.name: search_domains
parameters.description: List of domains to match search results for. Multiple domains can be included by separating them with '&'.

value_schema.description: A domain to match search results for. Multiple domains can be provided with &.

parameters.name: content_type_filters
parameters.description: List of content types to search, such as SITE_PAGE, LANDING_PAGE, BLOG_POST, LISTING_PAGE, and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE.

value_schema.description: Specifies the type of content to search. Can be one or more of SITE_PAGE, LANDING_PAGE, BLOG_POST, LISTING_PAGE, and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE. Defaults to all content types except LANDING_PAGE and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE

parameters.name: path_prefixes
parameters.description: An array of strings to filter search results by URL path prefix. Only returns results with paths starting with specified prefixes.

value_schema.description: Specifies a path prefix to filter search results. Will only return results with URL paths that start with the specified parameter. Can be used multiple times.

parameters.name: search_properties
parameters.description: A list of properties to include in the search. Options: `title`, `description`, `html`. By default, all properties are searched.

value_schema.description: Specifies which properties to include in the search. Options include `title`, `description`, and `html`. All properties will be searched by default.

parameters.name: result_length
parameters.description: Specifies whether search results should be detailed (LONG) or brief (SHORT).

value_schema.description: Specifies the length of the search results. Can be set to `LONG` or `SHORT`. `SHORT` will return the first 128 characters of the content's meta description. `LONG` will build a more detailed content snippet based on the html/content of the page.

parameters.name: blog_ids_to_search
parameters.description: List of blog IDs to search within. Allows searching multiple blogs by their IDs.

value_schema.description: Specifies which blog(s) to be searched by blog ID. Can be used multiple times to search more than one blog.

parameters.name: invert_path_prefix_filter
parameters.description: Set to 'false' to apply the normal behavior of the pathPrefix filter; 'true' to invert it.

value_schema.description: Inverts the behavior of the pathPrefix filter when set to `false`. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: show_autocomplete
parameters.description: Specify whether autocomplete results should be shown. Defaults to false.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether or not you are showing autocomplete results. Defaults to false.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the hubspot_cms API.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The term to search for.

value_schema.description: The term to search for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of results to be returned in a single response. Defaults to `10`. Maximum value is `100`.

value_schema.description: Specifies the number of results to be returned in a single response. Defaults to `10`. Maximum value is `100`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to page through the results. If there are more results than specified by the `limit` parameter, you will need to use the value of offset returned in the previous request to get the next set of results.

value_schema.description: Used to page through the results. If there are more results than specified by the `limit` parameter, you will need to use the value of offset returned in the previous request to get the next set of results.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Specifies the language of content to be searched. This value must be a valid [ISO 639-1 language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `es` for Spanish)

value_schema.description: Specifies the language of content to be searched. This value must be a valid [ISO 639-1 language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `es` for Spanish)

parameters.name: matchPrefix
parameters.description: Inverts the behavior of the pathPrefix filter when set to `false`. Defaults to `true`.

value_schema.description: Inverts the behavior of the pathPrefix filter when set to `false`. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: autocomplete
parameters.description: Specifies whether or not you are showing autocomplete results. Defaults to false.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether or not you are showing autocomplete results. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: popularityBoost
parameters.description: Specifies how strongly a result is boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 1.0.

value_schema.description: Specifies how strongly a result is boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 1.0.

parameters.name: boostLimit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum amount a result will be boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 5.0. Read more about elasticsearch boosting [here](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-boost.html).

value_schema.description: Specifies the maximum amount a result will be boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 5.0. Read more about elasticsearch boosting [here](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-boost.html).

parameters.name: boostRecent
parameters.description: Specifies a relative time window where scores of documents published outside this time window decay. This can only be used for blog posts. For example, boostRecent=10d will boost documents published within the last 10 days. Supported timeunits are ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

value_schema.description: Specifies a relative time window where scores of documents published outside this time window decay. This can only be used for blog posts. For example, boostRecent=10d will boost documents published within the last 10 days. Supported timeunits are ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: Specifies a specific HubDB table to search. Only returns results from the specified table. Can be used in tandem with the `hubdbQuery` parameter to further filter results.

value_schema.description: Specifies a specific HubDB table to search. Only returns results from the specified table. Can be used in tandem with the `hubdbQuery` parameter to further filter results.

parameters.name: hubdbQuery
parameters.description: Specify a HubDB query to further filter the search results.

value_schema.description: Specify a HubDB query to further filter the search results.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: A domain to match search results for. Multiple domains can be provided with &.

value_schema.description: A domain to match search results for. Multiple domains can be provided with &.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of content to search. Can be one or more of SITE_PAGE, LANDING_PAGE, BLOG_POST, LISTING_PAGE, and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE. Defaults to all content types except LANDING_PAGE and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE

value_schema.description: Specifies the type of content to search. Can be one or more of SITE_PAGE, LANDING_PAGE, BLOG_POST, LISTING_PAGE, and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE. Defaults to all content types except LANDING_PAGE and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE

parameters.name: pathPrefix
parameters.description: Specifies a path prefix to filter search results. Will only return results with URL paths that start with the specified parameter. Can be used multiple times.

value_schema.description: Specifies a path prefix to filter search results. Will only return results with URL paths that start with the specified parameter. Can be used multiple times.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: Specifies which properties to include in the search. Options include `title`, `description`, and `html`. All properties will be searched by default.

value_schema.description: Specifies which properties to include in the search. Options include `title`, `description`, and `html`. All properties will be searched by default.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Specifies the length of the search results. Can be set to `LONG` or `SHORT`. `SHORT` will return the first 128 characters of the content's meta description. `LONG` will build a more detailed content snippet based on the html/content of the page.

value_schema.description: Specifies the length of the search results. Can be set to `LONG` or `SHORT`. `SHORT` will return the first 128 characters of the content's meta description. `LONG` will build a more detailed content snippet based on the html/content of the page.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Specifies which blog(s) to be searched by blog ID. Can be used multiple times to search more than one blog.

value_schema.description: Specifies which blog(s) to be searched by blog ID. Can be used multiple times to search more than one blog.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
